casebody.data:
CITY OF BRIDGETON, DEFENDANT IN CERTIORARI, v. JOSEPH CORSON, PROSECUTOR IN CERTIORARI. Decided July 14, 1923.

Before Justices Kalisch, Black and Katzenbach.

For the prosecutor, Rex A. Donnelly. For the defendant, Walter H. Bacon, Jr. Per Curiam.

For the reasons given in the per curiam opinion, filed in the City of Bridgeton, defendant in certiorari, v. Hugh Smith, Jr., prosecutor in certiorari, the judgment in this case is reversed, with costs. See City of Bridgeton v. Smith, ante p. 398.
